t: Come,*p and let us return unto the Lord:*s for he hath torn, and he will heal us; he hath smitten, and he will bind us up.
After*p two days will he revive us: in the third day he will raise us up, and we shall live in his sight.
Then*p shall we know, if we follow on to know the Lord:*s his going forth is prepared as the morning; and he shall come unto us as the rain, as the latter and former rain unto the earth.
O*p Ephraim, what shall I do unto thee? O Judah, what shall I do unto thee? for your goodness is as a morning cloud, and as the early dew it goeth away.
Therefore*p have I hewed them by the prophets; I have slain them by the words of my mouth: and thy judgments are as the light that goeth forth.
For*p I desired mercy, and not sacrifice; and the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.
But*p they like men have transgressed the covenant: there have they dealt treacherously against me.
Gilead*p is a city of them that work iniquity, and is polluted with blood.
And*p as troops of robbers wait for a man, so the company of priests murder in the way by consent: for they commit lewdness.
I*p have seen an horrible thing in the house of Israel: there is the whoredom of Ephraim, Israel is defiled.
Also,*p O Judah, he hath set an harvest for thee, when I returned the captivity of my people.
